messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] periods/school
messages.msgSnippet: nancy, I m so sorry this happened to you. Our cycles should be  a source of empowerment and strength. Be well, Janis ... From: Nancy Liedel To:
messages.messageBody:
nancy,
I'm so sorry this happened to you. Our cycles should be a source of empowerment and strength.

Be well,
Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: Nancy Liedel
To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 07, 2003 8:28 AM
Subject: RE: [Unschooling-Discussion] periods/school


I was the first one in my class to get my period and I was beaten up by a
5th grader (I was at the tail end of the fourth grade) for getting my period
before her. I will never forget her grabbing my pads out of my purse and
showing them around I was pretty much screwed up with my period for years
after that.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] periods/school
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: Nancy Liedel To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com Sent: Thursday, August 07, 2003 6:28 AM Subject: RE: [Unschooling-Discussion] periods/school
messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: Nancy Liedel
To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 07, 2003 6:28 AM
Subject: RE: [Unschooling-Discussion] periods/school


<<<I was the first one in my class to get my period and I was beaten up by a
5th grader (I was at the tail end of the fourth grade) for getting my period
before her. I will never forget her grabbing my pads out of my purse and
showing them around I was pretty much screwed up with my period for years
after that.>>>

Jeez! I'm sorry that happened to you. Gosh. There were some freaky girls at my school, too, that would expose other girls having their periods. It's such a sensitive special time and some girls that age can be so terribly cruel. I could never understand that. I'm so glad I have my girl at home and when that time comes for her, we can celebrate that milestone, instead of me having to teach her how to deal with cruel kids at school.

Nichole

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: periods/school
messages.msgSnippet: I can so relate to this!!  I got my period at 10 and it was super heavy crampy.  Every time I bled through my clothes, the school insisted I be taken to the
messages.messageBody:
I can so relate to this!! I got my period at 10 and it was super heavy
crampy. Every time I bled through my clothes, the school insisted I be
taken to the doctor to make sure I wasn't having a miscarriage, can you
imagine?! I just hope Harriet starts at a more reasonable age. That
was a lot to handle - I wasn't ready yet.
On Wednesday, August 6, 2003, at 12:13 PM,
Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> Thats one thing I thought of. My daughter will never have to worry
> about
> boys tipping out her bag and finding sanitary products.
> She'll never have to worry of she's leaking and will it show on her
> clothes and be embaressed about asking a teacher if she can
> go to the bathroom. I once had a teacher ask why I was taking my bag
> with me. The whole class started to titter.
> Gawds, what terrible memories.
> :-(
>
--
Heather, mom to
Harriet 12.15.99
Crispin 01.25.02
heatherette@...


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
